article_title: Ike, Ford, and a Lost Voice in Supreme Court Nominations

article_metadata.description: Jeffrey Frank writes about historical precursors to the looming battle to replace Antonin Scalia on the Supreme Court.

og.description: Antonin Scalia’s death has reawakened all the animus, or fury, that has followed the Supreme Court since the nineteen-sixties.
og.title: Ike, Ford, and a Lost Voice in Supreme Court Nominations - The New Yorker
